Early Days of Ethereum

Articles and videos detailing the early days of the Ethereum project

  • Home
  • Articles
  • People
  • Videos
  • GitHub

Ethereum Foundation Timeline

This is an attempt by Bob Summerwill (along with Ethereum Foundation People) at building up some canonical history of the Ethereum Project and the Ethereum Foundation.

See also the partial public histories in:

  • Cut and Try – Building a Dream, written by Taylor Gerring in February 2016
  • History of Ethereum, written by the community for Homestead in March 2016
  • A Prehistory of the Ethereum Protocol, written by Vitalik Buterin in September 2017

Timeline 2013

  • Earliest Messages between Vitalik and Gav – 19th Dec 2013
    • Tweet by Vitalik: “The earliest emails from @gavofyork reaching out to me in Dec 2013. Thanks a lot for Gav’s crucial contributions to ethereum!”
    • Tweet by Gav: “Thanks to @VitalikButerin for the same – I could never have built #ethereum without you :)”
    • Tweet by Peter: “Ah yes, thank you @gavofyork for single handedly building #Ethereum! We – the other 30+ programmers – really enjoyed watching you work!”
    • In Gav’s Epicenter interview, he named Jonathan James Harrison AKA “Jonny Bitcoin” as the individual who pointed out Ethereum to him. He had met Johnny through Amir Taaki: Epicenter Episode 259

Timeline 2014

  • Who were the Founders of Ethereum?
    • Reddit Discussion

(Old photo of ethereum.org website shows a selection of the early people)

  • Introducing Ethereum, 23rd Jan 2014
    • YouTube Video
  • North American Bitcoin Conference, Miami, 25th and 26th January 2014
    • YouTube Video
    • Vitalik Buterin (Ethereum), a star is born – North American Bitcoin Conference in Miami (Jan 2014)

Beach house in Miami in February, where first face-to-face development happened - 31st January 2014

(The Ethereum team in their Miami house rented by Antony Di Iorio for the 2014 Bitcoin conference. Top (left to right): Dino Mark, Yanislav Malahov, Charles Hoskinson, Antony D’Onofrio, Steve Dakh, Wendell Davis, Jonathan Mohan, Joseph Lubin, Louis Parker. Bottom (left to right): Gavin Wood, Vitalik Buterin, Anthony Di Iorio, Taylor Gerring, Jason Colby, Kyle Kurbegovich)

(this image is from Taylor’s twitter thread, with caption and names taken from Why Polkadot is The Next Big Mover This Bull Cycle)
